Stayed about a week
review_text: We thoroughly enjoyed our week in Jackie's home. It was clean, well-provisioned, and comfortable. The hosts, who live just across a small yard, were friendly and responsive. The neighborhood is full of trees and peace, with short walks to a shopping street and parks and the lake. Because we're older, we would have appreciated some support at the steep front step and the claw foot tub, but Jackie was more than clear in her description and reiterated about accessibility in her messages. We cooked more than many might, and her kitchen supplies, such as dishes and cookware, were top-notch. For most, the small fridge is plenty, but we missed a regular fridge a little, especially after we visited the amazing farmer's market on the square! Thanks to Jackie and her husband for a restful stay!

We had everything needed to make all meals there. It was extremely convenient to downtown or for us close to Alliant Energy Center for the CrossFit Games. There was a lake a short walk away and Willy's co-op was awesome for grocery food selections right around the corner. Jackie was responsive and friendly and helped make adjustments to our length of stay and amount of guests easily. You are in a small guest house behind her home but we didn't feel that it was an issue at all. We saw them here and there but still felt like we had our own space. Would recommend!

name: Graeme
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We stayed at Jackie's place over a weekend for the Ironman Triathlon that takes place in September. And this is seriously one of my favorite Airbnbs that I have stayed in. I think everything about it was just awesome.
The location is fantastic. It sits by the lake in a cool little neighborhood just off Williamson Street. Williamson St. has a great selection of coffee houses, restaurants, bars and stores only a couple of minutes walk away. Totally safe area to walk around, even after dark. It's only a 10-15 minute walk to the State Capital building in downtown and everything else in that area.
The place itself is a cozy two room place. One is a bed room, the other is a living room/dining room area. There's not really a kitchen to speak off, but an area with a fridge, sink, microwave, kettle and coffee maker - all we really needed as we ate out every night. It is stylishly decorated from local shops with an independent feel.
Jackie was the perfect host - friendly and communicative (even though we never met her in person). However it was the little personal touches that really made this place stand out. From her recommendation of local establishments to try out, to the cheese and cracker board she left out for us as a welcome present (local WI cheeses). As well as a little selection of locally made chocolates.

name: Jesse

Rating, 5 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
What can I say about this Madison gem?
First, trust the pictures. This space is even more beautiful than they can convey. It was absolutely spotless throughout. Quality shampoo, conditioner, and soap was provided in the bathroom. Bring a bath bomb and a soak in the claw foot tub. Heaven.
There were two types of WI cheese, chocolates, crackers, and grapes waiting for us in the kitchen. Coffee, tea, cream were provided as well.
The bedroom is large and the bed and bedding are high quality and extremely comfortable. The host even put a vase of fresh roses on the dresser.
The living room is a bright, peaceful place to hang out. There is a TV here (also in the bedroom) which works with Roku. The patio off the living room is private and serene. It's the perfect place to have coffee in the morning, a glass of wine in the evening, and to read and relax throughout the day.
The neighborhood is walkable with the lake close by, and Williamson St. (Willy St.) just a few short blocks away. The host provided a detailed guide with area recommendations and directions. I had a car and the host provided a covered parking spot.
I will definitely be returning the next time I need a place to stay in Madison.

name: Richard
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We wanted a quiet weekend, but with easy access to restaurants etc. What an enjoyable stay!
Jackieâ€™s apartment was extremely comfortable, relaxing, private, clean, and beautifully appointed. The apartment is actually it's own free-standing building, and parking is easy and a few feet away from the front door. The apartment was very spacious for two guests. The living room is both roomy and cozy and has plenty of seating areas to lounge on. There are plenty of shelves to put your belongings, like phones, books, glasses, keys, etc. Everything is immaculately clean, including the sofaâ€™s cushions, bed linens, bathrooms, towels, kitchen, and utensils. Sheets and pillows are wonderfully comfortable.
Jackieâ€™s design of the space is aesthetically pleasing and unique, and every detail has been carefully chosen for both function and style. There is lots of closet space, hangers, wall hooks, drawers to organize your clothes. There is a hall closet well stocked with amenities, including extra pillows, comforter, ironing board, iron, etc. The kitchenette is fully stocked with cutlery, dishes, glasses, and all that you need to make coffee and tea, as well as amenities for tidying up (dish soap, sponge, garbage bags, dish rack, etc.). On the two TV's, thereâ€™s Netflix and Amazon Prime Video available. Jackie also provided high-end snacks, filtered water, coffee, teas, etc., as well as good quality soap, shampoo, and conditioner. There is a lot of attention to detail to ensure that guests are comfortable in their stayâ€”a great mix of professional-grade functionality, thoughtful hospitality, and homey creature comfort.
The location of the apartment is superb. Itâ€™s quiet and private, so you can leave the window blinds open to let the sun stream into the living room. There are lovely birds singing outside. Two blocks away in one direction thereâ€™s the Monona lake front and two blocks away in the other direction there is Williamson (Willy) Street with tons of interesting restaurants, cafes, shops, and an excellent co-op supermarket.
Overall we had a very comfortable stay and confidently recommend this apartment to others.

review_text: The space Gregory rents is really nice; it is clean, well-decorated, and homey feeling. I really appreciated the comfortable furniture and bed, art on the walls, the table for eating and working, chairs for enjoying the garden and fire, and using the kitchenette. There were also plenty of towels. One thing that's not explicitly included in the listing, which was a nice surprise, was a sturdy curtain with a latch and lock for securing the space while inside; this helped me feel like I had enough privacy to sleep well. As other reviewers mentioned, you can hear some noise upstairs when the hosts are on their main floor living space - which can be a problem if you go to bed early and you're a light sleeper.

We had the entire lower level of the house to ourselves, which includes a very large living area with a gas fireplace and many floor to ceiling windows overlooking Greg's beautifully manicured flower gardens. He has an extensive book collection on the shelves (travel, art, architecture, Frank Lloyd Wright, pottery, fiction, classics, picture books, etc) so we could have been very happy staying there much longer to just enjoy his books and the view! His house is convenient to arteries leading to downtown Madison. Greg was a source of great suggestions about local events and great places to visit. We would definitely stay at Greg's house again!

We slept great here.

Stayed about a week
review_text:
Lori is an absolutely fabulous host.
This was my second time staying at her property (a friend had booked with her for a trip we took to Madison in June 2022), so I knew exactly what to expect and how lovely the accommodations are for travel in Madison.
Less than three blocks from Lake Monona, easily accessible to downtown or the Beltline, not to mention all of the businesses along Monona Drive, this property lets you live like a local and soak up all that the east side has to offer.
The beds are extremely comfortable and have great linens, there is great water pressure, the kitchen is perfect for cooking meals (or warming up leftovers from any of your favorite Madison eateries), and the WiFi is strong if you need to do some work remotely.
I really appreciate Loriâ€™s aesthetic, her gorgeous gardens, all the extra touches (menus, grocery discount card, labels on light switches and locks), and the sun porch. Iâ€™m only 5â€™5â€, so the lower level apartment may feel short to someone much taller, but it is extremely cozy and I appreciate having access to natural light while inside.
In my opinion, itâ€™s a definite must-stay if you are coming to Madison!

name: Mary
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay! Lori has great attention to detail and anticipated any problems by having helpful signs and clear, concise instructions for TV, house rules, checkout etc. Lori really thinks of everything, so you can relax and feel right at home. The apartment was immaculately clean, and we loved the fun vintage decor. Plenty of room for 2 adults, as long as you aren't over 6' tall, as the ceilings are low. No problem for me and my 5' 10" husband. The bed was comfortable, the office nook was handy and the wifi connectivity was good. The kitchen was well equipped for small scale cooking. The bathroom was very clean, well-lit and the shower had good water pressure and plenty of hot water and ample towels. Though the apartment is in the basement it is quiet, and it feels cozy and snug, not gloomy. There is also lovely sunroom upstairs, and a garden area outdoors, plus BBQ and fire pit. Early March isn't the best time of year for being outside, so we'll have to come back to make the most of those features :) The location worked well for our activities in Madison, everything was less than a 20 minute drive. In warmer weather we would definitely go check out the lake and the nearby bike trail. Overall, we couldn't have had a more pleasant stay and we hope to come back again--Many Thanks again, Lori!

It was very convenient for us as she lives only a couple of blocks away. It's also a quick drive to the airport, restaurants, groceries, etc.
The space itself is well laid out with comfortable furniture. The kitchen is well-stocked with dishes, pots, pans, and the like. There's a stove, oven, and microwave. Coffee machine and tea kettle as well. A nice large TV if you're into TV.
Some other reviews mention the two low spots in the ceiling. And they are there! But I'm 6'2" and experienced no problems or head bumps.
We will definitely contact Lori next time we're staying in Monona or Madison!

It is close enough to take walks around scenic Lake Monona, yet still be a 10-minute drive from being in Madison. The driveway parking spot and separate entrance allowed us to come and go during the day in between seeing Williamson St., State St., the State Capitol, both Monona Terrace and Memorial Union Terrace. Lori was communicative and provided instructions for anything we needed. We would gladly stay again!

Lori's garden apartment is a beautiful, comfortable, quiet apartment in the basement of her home, artfully furnished and wonderfully cool during the hot summer days. It has its own entrance, a little kitchen that has all the appliances and equipment we needed for making meals, and many thoughtful touches such as purified water in the fridge and nice quality towels in the bathroom. A wonderful benefit is the private use of a sun room overlooking the beautiful garden, from which Lori actually gave us a couple of plants to bring home!
Monona is a lush residential neighborhood and Lori's home is not far from the Olbrich Gardens. We came to Madison to visit our son who lives near downtown and the Capitol, which was about a 15-20 minute drive away.
We highly recommend Lori's place!

review_text:
Dear Travelers,
We gave Lori the Ganzlin-Kilmer FIVE STAR GOLD AWARD, she could not have improved on anything, she achieved perfection in our opinion. Lori's guest suite and our visit was without a doubt the most wonderful Airbnb experience to date. I will also admit we have pretty high standards, Lori surpassed them all! :-)
Lori's guest suite is absolutely stunning, spotless, magically decorated like only Lori could do, I mean AMAZING dÃ©cor! The bathroom is very roomy and spotless, the kitchen is perfect, spotless, well equipped right down the very thoughtful delicious breakfast items she provided.
Lori's beautiful glassed in sunroom was just that and so much more! Enjoying a glass of wine in her sunroom, and being in the middle of her amazing English Garden truly made us feel like royalty! My husband enjoyed an early career as a landscaper, we both marveled at how beautiful her garden was, AND, she did every single thing herself! It was truly magic.
While we were in the middle of town, we felt like we were in a little piece of heaven, it was so quiet and peaceful.
The best part was meeting Lori! We loved our visits, Lori is amazingly talented and has a beautiful heart and a warm welcoming smile.
We felt at home from the minute we arrived. :-)
Thank you Lori, you are invited to visit us in the Bay Area anytime, we look forward to our next visit.
Until then, THANK YOU LORI so many hugs coming your way.
Jules and Stephen
Fremont, California

review_text:
We loved our stay at Loriâ€™s! We found it last minute after we cancelled a camping trip due to weather, and it was affordable and impressive. The apartment is very comfy and welcoming, with cute vintage decor and plenty of spare blankets (always something I love). The entire space was clean as a whistle, and everything you could ask for was provided. There is a queen bed, a twin bed, a working space with a printer, a cozy chair and a small breakfast table. Lots of storage space!
The kitchen sported a full coffee/tea set up, cookware and even some breakfast items in the fridge. We felt so at home that we chose to make dinner in both nights, rather than going out! There is a cute sunroom and amazing garden with seating to enjoy your morning meal.
The bathroom was fully stocked with shampoo, conditioner, lotion and body wash. Spare towels aplenty, a hairdryer and a basket full of emergency personal care items like tampons, a toothbrush, etc. It was a great touch!
Our absolute favorite thing about our stay was the amazingly comfortable bed! It was so cozy that we wished we were staying an extra day. Lori provided a space heater to keep us comfortable, and it was heaven. also the TV is huge and super fancy - we brought along our Roku so we could watch the Game of Thrones finale!
All in all, we give it an A+. Lori was just a message away and made sure we had all of the information we needed for our stay. Stay here!

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Overall 10/10 stay! The place looks even better than the pictures! Luxurious linens, pillows, bed. I even asked for the store Jennifer got some of the items! Incredible location, walking distance to lots of cool spots! Shower was heavenly and the ability to use the laundry machine was great. Many Airbnbâ€™s request you to do many chores despite a cleaning fee, whereas this rental only asks you to clean your dishes. There are a few suggestions I may have to make this space incredible- it is listed as self check in, however, Jennifer asks to meet with you/greet you prior to checking in and giving you the code. It is a safety measure that I totally respect- it looks like other reviewers appreciate being greeted. However, I had a busy day, didnâ€™t check airbnb inbox to see that this meeting was required prior to receiving the code. My in laws got there early & had to wait. I also recommend mounting the antenna to the wall and including directions for the tv, as we were having signal issues.

There's a great corner store less than a block away to get little grocery needs. Johnson Public House had some of the best breakfast sandwiches we've ever had and great coffee to start the days too! Hosts were super nice and flexible, even let us park in driveway - we'll definitely be back.

The location was perfect - just a 10 minute drive from campus and we could walk to shops in the neighborhood. The basement level private floor was very well finished and comfortable, with a private entrance that was easy to access and parking right by the front door for one car. WiFi and TV worked well, and though the kitchen space was small, it had everything we needed. The one bathroom had a good shower. You could hear some noise through the roof from upstairs, but it was not that loud and we got used to it by our second day. Jennifer and her family were very nice and great hosts. We would definitely stay there again.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Great trip to Madison. Jennifer's basement apartment was perfect for us -- we brought our almost-four-year-old and our 6 month old baby. She provided a pack n play and even toddler utensils. Beds and pillows were unusually comfortable. Sound machines in each bedroom provided some great white noise for the baby's sleep. Also great to have a washer and dryer for baby things. It was easy to watch our children there. The central location (isthmus) was convenient for our purposes -- we were house hunting and towed our kids with us to 12 properties all around the Madison suburbs (every direction!). Great coffee nearby at Johnson Public House, and also within walking distance of some tasty restaurants. The only difficulty we had was trying to find diapers at 9pm. My husband ended up at some campus Target, then a Walgreens, both of which only catered to college students. We were probably just looking in the wrong places. Very glad to stay at this home, and would definitely recommend her place for families like ours!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
We came to Madison for the Ironman Triathlon and stayed in Jennifer and Andrewâ€™s home for 5 nights. We appreciated having all the toys for our young daughter and the backyard made our stay that much nicer. Check-in was super simple, and though the home shows its age, it added to the charm of being in such a cute city where most of the other homes are character/heritage houses. So we felt a bit like locals staying here. We didnâ€™t get dirty feet from walking around in bare feet like some places we have stayed in. When we wiped the bathroom floor after a splash from bath time, the towel was clean. In other words, the place was very clean. We had plenty of hot water and the climate control is very efficient. Jennifer and Andrew were very generous in offering their spices and other cooking basics to us. They even offered to put up a child safety gate on the stairs for us, and provided a high chair. There is no microwave, but with a bit of planning, the toaster oven managed
the job fine. Thank-you for hosting us!

All amenities were provided and easy to use kitchen, bathroom. The only thing we regret is not being able to enjoy more time in the home with a backyard bbq or front porch happy hour!
Check in is easy as can be and Jennifer communicates perfect to lay out all information!
STAY HERE!

Rating, 4 stars

,
Â·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
Jordan is one of the very best hosts I've dealt with. He obviously knows what he's doing and goes to great lengths to get the details right.
Jordan provided excellent instructions for check-in. There's a code-activated lock on the door, which worked perfectly until I inadvertently locked the deadbolt (when it was dark and getting cold. No problem - Jordan had me in in a few minutes).
The space was spotlessly clean and well-supplied with linens, towels, coffee, etc. I had a few questions about how things worked and Jordan replied with detailed answers in 5 minutes. Great host.
The neighborhood is OK...I called it walkable in the review but that's only true if you're willing to walk for 20 minutes to the supermarket. There is a great gym a 15-minute walk away and it's worth it (best gym I've ever seen).
The only negative comment is I don't think the place is a good value for what you get. Kind of a last-minute booking for me.

review_text: This was my second time staying with Jordan and I would happily return. Jordan is a reliable, friendly host. It's an attic level space, so as others have mentioned if you're very tall, watch your head. However, I find the compactness cozy and appreciate that the space has everything I need for a visit to Madison. The bed and sheets are very comfortable and the space heater/fireplace feature does the trick on a cold night. The location is really convenient to the trail system and parking is a breeze.

review_text: There was much to appreciate about Jordanâ€™s Cape Cod BnB. Nightimes were very quiet, without much auto traffic and no airplanes in/out of the nearby Madison airport. (It should be noted that airplanes were loud during daytime, especially occasional flights of fighter jets.) Appliances worked well, and we enjoyed the wall-mounted electric fireplace for its light and warmth. The stairs were manageable, as pictured in the web views. But the shower could be risky for people with physical limits. We had some difficulty with the angled ceilings (it would be especially difficult for tall people). Bed and blankets were comfortable. Our only suggestion is that a basket of crackers or fruit would be nice for tired, hungry arrivals. There is coffee/tea, but one would have to run out for any food. The price was right and access was easy via the Schlage lock system.

review_text:
What a great place to lay your head. The area felt safe and you can not find a better price for that close to downtown Madison. The downstairs unit is also an airbnb but we didn't hear anything from our upstairs unit so it was very quiet. It was exceptionally clean, and the linens smelled nice and weren't startchy.
The loft is not gonna be a place you bring your friends to hang out nor was it meant to be. It is a small space, but it is exactly what I was expecting from the pictures. I'm 6'3" so definitely had to watch my head when going up the stairs (and when going to the bathroom), but plenty of headroom for everything else.
The amenities were exactly as described and great! When we arrived into town it was 15 degrees, but the heater warmed up in no time and it was nice and toasty.
The host was very accommodating and responsive. The directions for checking in were simply and easy to follow.
If you're looking for a great place to lay your head in Madison this is the place!

review_text:
We were traveling to Madison during a very intense heat wave with smoke/air quality advisories with our 2 senior pups and this place was great at not only keeping us cool but our elderly dogs.
The neighborhood was great to walk them around with the large shade trees. We thoroughly enjoyed being so close to different eating options as well. We walked to the coffee/pastry shop (CafÃ© Domestique) one morning then Ogden's North Street Diner the next (small, loud and def surrounded by regulars, but worth the wait. Next time we will try to hit the Young Blood Beer Company (inside same building the coffee shop is) and Tip Top Tavern since they too were only one block away and had a shaded dog friendly patio.
The unit was just what we were looking for. Cool, spacious, and in a quiet neighborhood. I made a couple recommendations while we stayed and the hosts noted them positively. There is def noise from the upstairs but it was stated in the listing when we booked so it was not a surprise.

review_text: This apartment was cute, well furnished and supplied with pots/pans/dishes/glasses and cleaning supplies. Emily was kind enough to leave bus passes, coins for laundry as well as laundry detergent, snacks, milk/butter/olive oil/coffee to get started! Apartment was walking distance to bar/restaurants nearby as well as UW hospital where I worked. Emily was very open and honest about maintenance issues and gave ample notice of when theyay need to come into the apartment. Emily also took into consideration that I worked nights, and made sure maintenance respected my need to sleep during the day. Emily checked in frequently throughout my stay to see how everything was going. At the end of my stay, Emily was flexible in my checkout date and refunded me for nights I no longer needed the rental. I would give Emily 5 stars as a host and would rent from her in the future.
